Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of law enforcement officers killed in the line of duty since Obama took office.
Understate: The claim understates the recognition given by the White House to fallen law enforcement officers.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the White House gave "no special recognition" to fallen law enforcement officers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the White House should provide special recognition to every fallen law enforcement officer.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the White House did provide recognition to fallen officers, but it may not have been widely publicized or acknowledged.
